examples.text: in memory of our dearly beloved son, John
They were glad to be back in their beloved Ireland.

definitions.definition: loved very much by somebody; very popular with somebody

examples.text: the deep purple flowers so beloved by artists
She was beloved by all who knew her.
The question, ‘What is History?’, beloved of university examiners, has no definitive answer.

wordOrigin: late Middle English: past participle of obsolete belove ‘be pleasing’, later ‘love’.
